text: old buildings here got retrofit solar tech - eco meets retro!

i'm always fascinated by how city spaces are transformed into art - murals popping up on old building walls elevating a bland façade & creating community through shared visuals 🎨 gotta love when form meets function!
preserving history totally matters! keeping old charms important alongside new vibes
sorta miss unique local spots tho
yeah as hipster boutiques replace classic shops like agora you can't even get traditional treats without hunting for small hidden gems... kinda sad when cities lose their unique flavors 😔
so many coworking spaces popping up now! 🤯
city vibes can jazz you up but some quiet time's essential too
feels like surfing - sometimes u catch an awesome wave, other times wipe out hard 😵 gotta find those chill spots though to keep sane amidst chaos 🌿🏙️
absolutely - gotta mix short breaks with real downtime 🛌🏞️
dock spooks just add flavor to fish tales tbh 🎣
every town has its tales but let's be real - most are just there for tourism boost 😂 gotta admit though, sometimes i check over my shoulder when walking past certain "haunted" spots...just in case
haunted spots here are just tourist traps really
"haunted spots everywhere but science says nah"
had one neighbor who practiced bagpipes every evening - kinda miss it since they moved out, everything’s too quiet now 😂 ever notice you get used to even the oddest noises?
my upstairs neighbour thinks he's a dj spinning decks till 3am! apartment walls aren’t soundproof enough for his "sick beats" 🙉
dynamic's cool but without roots & community vibe you might end up feeling lost eventually - flash convos don’t always cut it if there’s no deeper connection happening 🏡💔
seriously though - hometown vibes now are cozy nooks & creativity bustling everywhere
so true that vibes make so much of our sense of belonging! ever notice how certain smells just take you back? gotta love those scent-triggered flashbacks 😌
def think you can spice up routine - ever tried themed dinner parties? boosts both coziness+creativity! 😜🍽
totally see both sides - having a chill spot at home rocks but so does mixing things up! balancing comfort & adventure keeps life spicy without going full nomad 😜
home sweet (mobile) home – best way forward! embrace spontaneity but keep that personal haven waiting 👌
fixed a bike tire first time - no youtube! felt boss 😎
just budgeted an entire month right—no takeout temptations!
nailed making a budget spreadsheet even tho i used hate anything numbers related! looking at those color-coded expenses now feels oddly therapeutic 😌
figured out all those tax forms solo after years dreading them 😮 feels so boss
finally got all household bills on autopay - goodbye late fees!
just trading one playbook for another seems kinda pointless... let’s just live 🤷‍♀️
life doesn’t follow preset rules - feeling content at own pace matters most!
totally agree - it's your story! 📘✨
felt that pressure too but kinda doing my own thing now
rent hikes hurt more than cutting back lattes tbh 😔
budgets are tight but still dreaming big!

def feels like chasing down specials at supermarkets has become more thrilling than any holiday planning 😂 keeping those dreamy goals flexible helps keep morale up without breaking bank! gotta get creative nowadays! 🎨💸
meal prepping sunday = week’s worth of savings!
started hosting game nights instead of going out - board games over bars saves so much cash plus its chill vibes all around
gardening’s underrated tbh - saves tons & chills me out
frugal lifestyle overrated - real joy ain't stuff-related anyway!
cooking at home + experimenting = 'chef' level fun minus expense!

visual arts degree here — figured i'd end up in some cool studio painting all day but designs for digital spaces stole my heart instead 😂 never saw myself clicking more than brushing! gotta say tho it’s still art just different canvas
studied visual arts; now making digital art magic happen ✨
yeah sorta same here creativity transcended different mediums tho
having a degree doesn't chain you down — i’m designing stuff now instead of just pondering visual theory like back at uni! careers can evolve; schools just lay groundwork imo 🎨🔄💼
studied visuals still designing things - fits perfect tbh

visual arts might seem useless post-apocalypse but hey still need creativity right? imagine designing camo patterns while everyone else plays rambo - we'd add color to whatever bunker we're hiding out 🎨💪

not gonna lie, some times i think all these ancient collapse stories might help understand failure but won’t fix broken stuff or grow food... cool for long term sure but short term? give me a multitool any day over marcus aurelius' meditations 🛠️
degree got me in the door but man, design world's so fast-paced! projects totally off script from what i learned – keeps me on my toes for sure 👌
visual arts - endless possibilities & odd jobs!
yeah sometimes felt like portfolio > diploma here
visual arts degree here thinking i'd paint all day - now i'm deep in pixels working for clients... anyone else not see THAT coming? lol guess uni doesn’t always prep you for real-world plot twists 😂
arts degree here - def didn't expect corporate gigs disrupting creative flow!

visual arts here - think it’d be chill just sketchin’ but nah, everywhere i look things turn into potential projects; critiquing fonts on menus even when out eatin’, that sorta thing 😂 stealth mode ain’t an option!
sometimes i catch ad layouts before reading articles - can totally point out where they messed up on alignment or typography! kinda ruins surfing online when you see all these 'faux pas' 😂
everyone decodes visuals daily but explaining why ads work on them? mind-blowing 😆
our color printer died - makeshift stamps saved our presentation!

once had client files corrupt right before deadline 😬 ended up screen grabbing final designs from thumbnail previews... pixelated but passed ‘til HQ versions recovered! talk about heart attack central lol
had to improvise during a pitch once – marker leaked on presentation boards so i sketched over it making it look intentional... client loved ‘the concept’ lol
risotto? fancy 😂 my thing's making logos pop after tons of sketches fail
designers' block sucks but nailing a tough logo design? best feeling ever!
ever noticed how even random street art can spark a design idea? got me seeing everyday stuff as potential project inspo - seriously eye-opening 👀 creativity’s like everywhere once you start looking
daily design grind grounds imagination - gives life meaning 🎨✨
always spotting patterns and colors everywhere now 🎨💡
creative work always hidden behind admin stuff

kinda relatable but found sticking close to creative roots even through unexpected changes keeps things fresh idk maybe blending old passions with new challenges probs helps also knowing when ya gotta pivot keeps it interesting 😌
spotting bad fonts everywhere now... thanks job 😂
design world's just as skewed - dudebro culture prevails everywhere
art world’s similar - progress mixed with stubborn stereotypes
diversity in tactics makes things interesting!
first pics matter too much tbh

sure, geography’s got its sway but don't forget our insta & tinder personas! feels kinda parallel to photoshop skills at work – you craft an image hoping reality can at least compete 🎨 some profiles are like expert-level branding campaigns ya know?
yeah hidden biases can influence us more than we think
art ftw regardless of old school norm bs
gender norms didn't guide me - art did 🎨
still feels like tokenism sometimes instead of actual change
ok but let's be real, some fields still gotta catch up, like creators' scenes can talk diversity all they want but it doesn't always show... more action less lip service pls
people saying "listen more" but then creating noise when describing their 'new' views on genders – seems like just repackaging old labels instead of tossing them out completly
def had moments when peeps thought artsy types can’t be tech-savvy 😒
same story at design studios; surprise when we fix printers 😄
yeah feels ya! ppl always expect me to fix their laptops 🙄
fam labels aren't always accurate tho 😤
julius had no chill lol but seriously society needs to chill with milestone pressures – not everyone wants or needs the same game plan by 30! 🎯
graphic design's more balanced now too
in graphic design it's always felt pretty balanced tbh 🎨 i guess some industries were ahead of the curve when it comes to breaking down those old school stereotypes
busy streets spark less inspo than melting pot markets!
city hustle’s cool but don't underestimate quiet spots where unique local stuff happens - think street art over graffiti wars 😌 gives kinda subtle vibe-check for creativity outside usual chaos
small corners tell tales too - like finding quiet courtyards where every stone sparks imagination 💡
not all change bad - could bring benefits too
hometown buzz? just background noise tbh
where i'm from beaches aren't all sandy... mind-blowing!
always thought cities would feel similar - big reality check!
crazy how every city buzz feels unique too
always felt those narrow cobbled streets back home taught me creative ways round any obstacle - like thinking outside box became second nature! 🎨✨
city living definitely forces some quick on-your-feet thinking too—not just space stuff!
always surrounded by art & heritage - led me into design!
